items.subject: [CHAMP: News] C.H.A.M.P.?s Weekend Update; Forecasting Next Events
items.snippet: *Report from C.H.A.M.P.?s 1st Foray, Lincoln, MA 12.7.25 * Larry started off saying something about the importance of noticing what we don?t see, but the presence of negative data couldn?t hold a cand
items.skinnyBody: *Report from C.H.A.M.P.?s 1st Foray, Lincoln, MA 12.7.25 * Larry started off saying something about the importance of noticing what we don?t see, but the presence of negative data couldn?t hold a candle to what materialized 10 minutes later: Bulgaria inquinans, commonly called Black Bulgar or Bachelor?s Buttons ? bulbous protrusions like gobs of tar emerging from huge sawn logs ? oak, I believe. Matte black, like Finnish licorice, with cup-like depressions. I mistakenly thought the name had something to do with the former Soviet country, Bulgaria, but etymology filled the binomial with color and motion: ?inflated,? ?blister-like;? ?dirtying,? ?polluting,? ?blackening,? ?staining,? ?making unclean.? So be it - the dirty, bulging fungi left me feeling renewed. Larry?s words and our presence as a group in the woods ? Jula, his Dad, Martin, and son Micha; Dan, Liam, Sean, KieuLy, Larry, and myself ? amplified a simple message: even on a chilly, steel-grey New England morning, the forest floor holds a cache of little treasures ? like Hanukkah gelt or Christmas cookies ? cups, crusts, and jellies, resplendent in a quiet but full-throated way, edging out the inelegant rumble of the MBTA commuter rail trundling by. Arboreal chamber music enjoyed from front-row seats, reminding me of John Cage, amateur mycologist and vanguard creator of aleatory music: ?There is no such thing as an empty space or an empty time. There is always something to see, something to hear. In fact, try as we may to make a silence, we cannot.? A quick rundown of notable species seen: a cascade of lumpy polypores ? Trametes gibbosa; oak-log sections tinted with green wood-staining fungus ? Chlorociboria sp.; tiny matchstick fungi ? Phaeocalicium polyporaeum ? lifting off from the margins of purple-tooth polypores ? Trichaptum abietinum; and, as if bidding us farewell like tiny munchkins from Oz, a ?hairy fairy? ? Lachnum virgineum; and a troupe of Mycena sp. *On the Horizon* Stay tuned for our next events. Plans are underfoot for a movie night pegged to an ethnographic film. [image: image.jpeg] [image: image.jpeg] [image: image.jpeg] [image: image.jpeg]

items.subject: [CHAMP: News] Reminder: Larry Millman?s walk @ 11 AM Sunday
items.snippet: *Not all fungi head to Florida for the winter!* RSVP <https://comm-hub-myco.github.io/champ-site/>. Join Larry Millman <https://comm-hub-myco.github.io/champ-site/> @ Codman Woods - Lincoln, MA <https
items.skinnyBody: *Not all fungi head to Florida for the winter!* RSVP <https://comm-hub-myco.github.io/champ-site/>. Join Larry Millman <https://comm-hub-myco.github.io/champ-site/> @ Codman Woods - Lincoln, MA <https://lincolnconservation.org/tws_holding/codman/>. Sunday @ 11:00 AM. Parking at Donelan's Supermarket - 145 Lincoln Road, Lincoln, MA 01773 <https://www.google.com/maps/search/145+Lincoln+Road,+Lincoln,+MA+01773?entry=gmail&source=g> . *C.H.A. <https://comm-hub-myco.github.io/champ-site/>**M.P. <https://comm-hub-myco.github.io/champ-site/>* *Community Hub for Actualizing Mycological Passion*

items.subject: [CHAMP: News] THE NEWS FEED IS NOW WORKING!
items.snippet: Simply email <comm.hub.myco@gmail.com> anything newsworthy! Include "[CHAMP: News]" in the subject line to automatically post the email on the CHAMP website's news feed. Keep the rest of the group up
items.skinnyBody: Simply email <comm.hub.myco@gmail.com> anything newsworthy! Include "[CHAMP: News]" in the subject line to automatically post the email on the CHAMP website's news feed. Keep the rest of the group up to date with ease! -Cody
